categories: Category:The Official Black Spire Outpost Cookbook recipes

nodes.text: Yobshrimp Noodle Salad was a dish comprised of chilled yobshrimp, noodles, and vegetables. The salad was created by Strono Tuggs and served at his traveling restaurant, Tuggs' Grub. The dish could be found at Docking Bay 7 Food and Cargo in Batuu's Black Spire Outpost when Tuggs docked his modified transport there as the visiting chef.

Yobshrimp Noodle Salad was a chilled salad that contained yobshrimp, noodles, and vegetables. The dish, which was safe for human consumption, was served in both adult- and youngling-sized portions at Docking Bay 7 Food and Cargo in Black Spire Outpost on the planet Batuu in 34 ABY.

The noodle salad was created by Artiodac chef Strono Tuggs to highlight the freshness of the yobshrimp, a decapod species native to Naboo's waters. It was dangerous to fish for them in the deep underwater Abyss due to the risk of the fisher being eaten themselves by colo claw fish or opee. Tuggs originally fished for the creatures himself using traps in Lake Paonga, but he failed to get permission from the Boss of the Gungans, a move he would later characterize as a "rookie mistake." Tuggs was brought into Otoh Gunga, where the Gungans established that he was not a threat and offered him a drink of Paonga Fresca. After that, Tuggs established a purchasing agreement with a Gungan who supplied him with yobshrimp at a reasonable price.

Tuggs used his modified starship, in which he had cargo pods with built-in life-support systems, to transport live yobshrimp and other fresh ingredients that he served at his mobile restaurant. The yobshrimp were marinated and tossed over a cold noodle salad. Explorer Eloc Throno, author of the Traveler's Guide to Batuu, ate the dish on Batuu and named it one of his favorites to eat on warm days. Tuggs wrote about the dish himself; he included his Yobshrimp Noodle Salad recipe and anecedotes about yobshrimp in his cookbook, The Official Black Spire Outpost Cookbook.

Yobshrimp Noodle Salad debuted in the real world Docking Bay 7 Food and Cargo at Disneyland's Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge, when the theme park's opening in 2019. The dish was first revealed as part of a large promotional event held on February 26, 2019. The dish consists of a marinated noodle salad with chilled shrimp and vegetables. In October 2019, the dish was renamed at Disney's Hollywood Studios to Surabat Shrimp and Noodle Salad as part of a wave of name changes. That name was also used in the 2020 reference book Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge: Traveler's Guide to Batuu by Cole Horton.

The original name and an out-of-universe recipe appear in the 2019 cookbook Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge: The Official Black Spire Outpost Cookbook by Chelsea Monroe-Cassel and Marc Sumerak. The vinaigrette is made with low-sodium soy sauce, lime juice, sugar, a minced clove of garlic, hot sauce, and xanthum gum. After the vinaigrette has marinated overnight, vermicelli rice noodles are boiled and then rinsed in cold water. The noodles are tossed with cooked shrimp and the vinaigrette, along with the following ingredients which are sliced: bell pepper, carrots, wood ear mushrooms, and red onion. The dish is then topped with minced cilantro and a pinch of salt before serving.
